gurmukhi: mwr ky bIr Gny rn mY bhu kop kY dwNqn ET cpwvY ] Awvq jo ieh ky Air aUpir bwnn isau iqh kwit igrwvY ]
transliteration: Maar Ke Beer Ghane Ran Mai Bahu Kop Kai Daantan Oth Chapaavai|| Oovat Jo Eh Ke Ar(i) Oopar(i) Baanan Sio Tih Kaattee Giraavai||
translation: The king Anag Singh, after killing many warriors in the battlefield, is cutting his lips with his teeth; whosoever falls upon him, he chops and throws him down;

gurmukhi: Awie pry irp ky dl mY dl kY ml kY bhuro isr DwvY ] ju`Du krY n frY hir isau Air ky rQ ko bl Er clwvY ]1166]
transliteration: Ooe Dare Rip Ke Dal Mai Dal Kai Mal Kai Bahuro Sir Dhaavai|| Juddh(u) Darai Na Darai Har(i) Sio Ar(i) Ke Rath Ko Bal Of Chalaavai||1166||
translation: He has fallen upon the enemy’s army and is destroying it; he does not have any fear of Krishna, while fighting and with great effort is driving his chariot towards Balram.1166.

gurmukhi: jb irp rn kIno Gno bFXo kiRSn qb qyhu ] jwdv pRiq hir XoN khXo duibDw kir hin lyhu ]1167]
transliteration: Jah Rip Ran Keeno Ghano Badhyo Krishan Tab The(u)|| Jaadav Prali Har(i) Yon Kahyo Doubidhaa Kar(i) Han(i) Leh(u)||1167||
translation: When the enemy waged the dreadful war, Krishna marched towards him and said to the Yadavas, “Kill him by fighting with him from both sides.”1167.

gurmukhi: swqk kwit dXo iqn ko rQ kwnH qbY kwit kY fwrXo ] sUq ko sIs ktXo muslI brmw kiRq AMg pRqMg pHwrXo ]
transliteration: Daatak Kaattee Dayo Tin Ko Rath Kaahn Tabai Kaattee Ddaryo Soot Ko Sees Katyo Mouslibarmaa Krit An Pratan Prahdaryo||
translation: Satyak shattered his chariot and Krishna also began killing violently; Balram chopped the head of his charioteer and struck blows on the limbs protected by armour;

gurmukhi: bwn AkRUr hnXo aur mY iqh jor lgXo nhI nYk sMBwrXo ] mUrC hY rn BUm igrXo As lY kir aUDv sIs auqwrXo ]1168]
transliteration: Baan Akroor Hanyo Ur Mai Tih Jor Lagyo Nahinaik Sanbhdaryo|| Moondachh Hai Bhoom Giryo As Lai Kar(i) Oodhav Sees Outdaryo||1168||
translation: The arrow of Akrur hit him so fiercely that he could not control himself; he fell unconscious in the battlefield and Udhava chopped his head with his sword.1168.

gurmukhi: Axg isMG jb mwirXo Kt suBtn imil Aaur ] jrwisMD kI sYn qy cly cqR niRp Aaur ]1169]
transliteration: Anag Singh Jab Maariyo Khat Soubhatan Mil(i) Aur|| Jaraasindh Kisain Te Chale Chatra Nrip Aur||1169||
translation: When the six warriors together killed Anag Singh, then four kings of the army of Jarasandh marched forward.1169.

gurmukhi: Amqys blI Aclys mhwN AGnysih lY Asurys isDwey ] bwn kmwn kiRpwn bfy brCy prsy su gdw gih Awey ]
transliteration: Amtes Baliachels Mahaan Aghnesah(i) Lai Asures Sidhaae|| Baan Kamaan Kridaan Bade Barchhe Parse Su Gadaa Gadh Aae||
translation: The four kings Amitesh, Achilesh, Aghnesh and Asuresh Singh marched forward; they were holding bows, arrows, swords, spears, maces and axes,

gurmukhi: ros kY bIr inSMk iBry Bt ky nit ky Bt EG prwey ] Awie iGrXo biRjBUKn kau mD dUKm kau bhu bwn lgwey ]1170]
transliteration: Ros Kai Beer Nishank Bhire Bhat Ke Nattee Ke Bhat Ogh Paraae|| Ooe Ghiryo Brij-bhookhan Kau Madh Dookhan Kau Bahu Baan Lagade||1170||
translation: They fought furiously and fearlessly, considering everyone alien to them and surrounding Krishna, they began to shower arrows upon him.1170.

gurmukhi: Gwien kau sih kY biRjrwj srwsn lY sr lyq BXo ] Asurysih ko isr kwit dXo Amqys kI dyh ibdwr CXo ]
transliteration: Ghaain Kau Sah(i) Kai Brijraaj Saraasan Lai Sar Let Bhayo|| Asuresah(i) Ko Sir Kaattee Dayo Amtes Kideh Bidaar Chhayo||
translation: Enduring the anguish of his wounds, Krishna held up his bow and arrows and cutting the head of Asuresh, he slashed the body of Amitesh;
